body_html: I think this isn't OS-specific, but agree that it's a bit strange. As a workaround, it might be possible to prepend "./" to the save path, and perhaps we should do that in the cases when os.path.dirname() returns ""?
body_text: I think this isn't OS-specific, but agree that it's a bit strange. As a workaround, it might be possible to prepend "./" to the save path, and perhaps we should do that in the cases when os.path.dirname() returns ""?
body: I think this isn't OS-specific, but agree that it's a bit strange. As a workaround, it might be possible to prepend `"./"` to the save path, and perhaps we should do that in the cases when `os.path.dirname()` returns `""`?
